[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Tech Support System (TSS) defines requirements for a web-based platform facilitating authentication, moderation, voting, and reporting to enhance support interactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: TSS supports user registration, Q&A interactions, moderation, voting, and secure data handling.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: TSS integrates with authentication, user management, and reporting services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: TSS provides a responsive UI for support interactions and profile management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: TSS operates on cloud servers, accessible via desktops, laptops, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: TSS uses React.js for frontend, Node.js with Express for backend, and PostgreSQL for storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: TSS ensures secure data transfer using TLS 1.3 and RESTful APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: TSS optimizes storage for high-volume interactions and real-time updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: TSS handles authentication, content submission, voting, and moderation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: TSS supports cross-device accessibility with a responsive UI.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: TSS links to authentication, cloud storage, and analytics services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: TSS enables authentication, content submission, voting, moderation, reporting, and secure data management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for users seeking support and administrators moderating content.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Requires an internet connection for real-time interactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Relies on authentication protocols, encrypted storage, and moderation policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Voting System: Mechanism allowing users to rate answers.
Moderation: Admin approval process before publishing content.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall authenticate and authorize users securely before granting access.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall allow users to register, reset passwords, and receive verification emails.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall generate activity and moderation reports for administrators.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to TO-BE-DEFINED (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable users to post, vote, and flag content for moderation (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow administrators to review flagged content, approve posts, and generate reports (REQ-INTF-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI with tooltips and guided navigation.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall retrieve and display content within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall generate reports within 10 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user data, content submissions, voting history, and moderation logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall maintain encrypted storage and secure authentication mechanisms.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with security best practices for data integrity.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure content reliability and efficient moderation.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Authentication, content posting, moderation, reporting validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API security documentation, moderation policies.
[SEC] 5. References: UI best practices, API security standards, content moderation guidelines.
